|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |price = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B00S6DB50C |asin_country = US |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |country = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->
|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== It's probably using RTL8811AU, per the driver set and specifications. Based on its appearance, it may be an [[Edimax EW-7811UTC]].
There are two '''Hawking''' RTL881xAU device noted within '''Hawking''''s drivers... *0e66:0022 (RTL8812AU, <small>'''Hawking USB Wireless-AC Network Adapter'''</small>) *0e66:0023 (RTL8811AU, <small>'''Hawking USB WLS 11AC Adapter'''</small>) This device may be the 8811AU dongle, however, this is not confirmed.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
